issue.title: PatternEditor: add missing keyboard actions for note handling
issue.body:
Hydrogen version *          : <=1.2

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

While rewriting the paragraph in the docs regarding note handling I realized that this is still poorly supported using keyboard. We can create and delete notes using <kbd>Enter</kbd>. But we can not

- [ ] set the length of a note (maybe <kbd>Alt</kbd> + <kbd>Left</kbd>/<kbd>Right</kbd>)
- [ ] adjust the selected note property (maybe <kbd>Alt</kbd> + <kbd>Up</kbd>/<kbd>Down</kbd>)
- [ ] add a stop-note ( <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>Enter</kbd>)

issue.title: fatal error: 'CoreMidi/CoreMidi.h' file not found
issue.body:
Hydrogen version *          : 1.2.2
Operating system + version  : macOS (any)
Audio driver + version      : N/A

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

CoreMIDI is miscapitalized in the source code, resulting in build failure on case-sensitive filesystems:

```
hydrogen-1.2.2/src/core/IO/CoreMidiDriver.h:36:10: fatal error: 'CoreMidi/CoreMidi.h' file not found
#include <CoreMidi/CoreMidi.h>
         ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
1 error generated.
```

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

issue.title: Sampler: trigger note release on custom length
issue.body:
custom note lengths are used to trigger the release of a note and the `Sampler` will play them back till the additional release frames are rendered. Previously, the custom length was used to stop audio rendering of a note creating a pronounced artifact.

From the looks of the code it is very likely that this worked for a long time but was broken just recently. Well, happens. But should not happen again as custom note lengths are now covered by the unit tests and even a tiny tweak on the release knob for the test song should make them fail.

Addresses #1873

comment.body: Turns out these patches also fix the rendering issues with active filtering. 🥳

issue.title: Export audio for looping
issue.body: As discussed in #1853 offer an option in the Export Song dialog using which all audio is truncated at the end of the last pattern and, instead, wrapped to the beginning of the song. (a bit like loop mode with transport looped more than once)

issue.title: export to wave adds long dead time !
issue.body:
Hydrogen version *          :1.2.0 
Operating system + version  : Mageia 9
Audio driver + version      :  pipewire on pulseaudio

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

My distribution (mageia) upgrade came with version 1.2.0 of hydrogen and (apparently) a new bug when exporting to a wave file: it adds a dead time (several measures) at the end so the wave file is not anymore the song i can hear in hydrogen and i cant use it as a loop! For instance it is twice longer than it should in the attached wave file. Got the same behaviour with 1.2.2 Appimage ! Got the issue even with default song opening in Hydrogen (so not mine)

comment.body:
Hmm... I can't reproduce the crash with your config. 

Could you run

```bash
jackd --version
```

Also, could you check [this build](https://ci.appveyor.com/api/buildjobs/0goyb42bifum4ok0/artifacts/Hydrogen-x86_64.AppImage) of Hydrogen? (or alternatively build from source in branch `phil-address-1867-artifacts`) I found a bug which _could_ be the cause. But I'm not sure.

Does the crash also occur when restarting the audio driver in the Preferences or just during shutdown? Does it matter whether playback is rolling or other JACK clients are present?

payload.description: The advanced drum machine for Linux, macOS, and Windows

comment.body:
Sorry for the delay. 
It's happening on two different system (my desktop and my laptop) with two different USB Audio Device (Behringer XAIR XR18 and Zoom U-44)
I use QjackCtl to start Jackd: Those are the settings for U-44 but the ones for XR18 are the same

![immagine](https://github.com/hydrogen-music/hydrogen/assets/89070208/3fed2e9a-20a1-4449-8010-e177025d1764)

![immagine](https://github.com/hydrogen-music/hydrogen/assets/89070208/481cc7bd-af61-4891-ad50-28b5f3bbb9c2)

And this is the content of my .jackrdc file:

/usr/bin/jackd -dalsa -dhw:U44 -r48000 -p1024 -n3 -Xraw -I60 -O60

pull_request.title: Sampler: trigger note release on custom length
pull_request.body:
custom note lengths are used to trigger the release of a note and the `Sampler` will play them back till the additional release frames are rendered. Previously, the custom length was used to stop audio rendering of a note creating a pronounced artifact.

From the looks of the code it is very likely that this worked for a long time but was broken just recently. Well, happens. But should not happen again as custom note lengths are now covered by the unit tests and even a tiny tweak on the release knob for the test song should make them fail.

Addresses #1873

repo.name: hydrogen
repo.description: The git repository of the advanced drum machine

repo.name: hydrogen
repo.description: The advanced drum machine for Linux, macOS, and Windows

commits.message:
AudioEngine: truncate custom note length on pattern end

in case a custom note length was defined and the pattern length was reduced afterwards it is now ensured that the custom length is truncated at the end of the pattern. Else, the note could ring beyond what is visually indicated to be its end.

Addresses #1873

Merge pull request #1882 from theGreatWhiteShark/phil-address-1873

AudioEngine: truncate custom note length on pattern end

commits.message:
rework Note handling in Sampler

- `Note::SelectedLayerInfo` was refactored to comply with your naming conventions
- `Note::SelectedLayerInfo::nNoteLength` was introduced to store the length of a note once it is first rendered in the `Sampler`. Doing it at each rendering cycles causes issues on manual tempo changes.
- `Sampler::handleTimelineOrTempoChange` does now also scale the part of a note/sample still left for rendering in case rendering already has begun. This is important in case of manual tempo changes for notes with user defined length.

Addresses #1873
Sampler: do not scale note length on tempo markers

Merge pull request #1881 from theGreatWhiteShark/phil-address-1873

Sampler: rework handling of notes with custom length on tempo changes

pull_request.title: Sampler: rework handling of notes with custom length on tempo changes
pull_request.body:
- `Note::SelectedLayerInfo` was refactored to comply with your naming conventions
- `Note::SelectedLayerInfo::nNoteLength` was introduced to store the length of a note once it is first rendered in the `Sampler`. Doing it at each rendering cycles causes issues on manual tempo changes.
- `Sampler::handleTimelineOrTempoChange` does now also scale the part of a note/sample still left for rendering in case rendering already has begun. This is important in case of manual tempo changes for notes with user defined length.

Addresses https://github.com/hydrogen-music/hydrogen/issues/1873
